alerts.headline: rainfall warning ended

Significant rainfall is no longer expected.


###

alerts.headline: special weather statement in effect
alerts.description:
Icy conditions possible Monday night into Tuesday.

What:
Icy and slippery surfaces.
Risk of freezing rain.

When:
Monday night into Tuesday morning.

Additional information:
A low pressure system will bring rain to the area on Monday. Rain will change to ice pellets or freezing rain and then snow Monday night as the temperature falls below zero. Surfaces may become icy and slippery due to standing water freezing and any freezing rain that falls. Freezing rain warnings may be issued as this system approaches.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: rainfall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Heavy rain expected Monday.

What:
Rainfall amounts of 30 to 50 mm.

When:
Monday morning through Monday night.

Additional information:
A low pressure system will bring heavy rain and thunderstorms to the area Monday. The frozen ground has a reduced ability to absorb this rainfall.

For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources office. Visit Ontario.ca/floods for the latest details.

###

Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: If visibility is reduced while driving, turn on your lights and maintain a safe following distance.
